Study: Flattening the Curve by Getting Ahead of It: How the VA Healthcare System Is Leveraging Telehealth to Provide Continued Access to Care for Rural Veterans.
Challenge: As the US scrambles to deliver health care during the COVID-19 pandemic, expanding telehealth services has become the most prominently employed access strategy across the majority of health care systems
Solution: VHA has dramically increased telehealth visits so veterans can remain connected and engaged in their care while limiting travel and maintaining social distancing to support efforts of flattening the curve.

Study: Compounding Health Risks and Increased Vulnerability to SARS-CoV-2 for Racial and Ethnic Minorities and Low Socioeconomic Status Individuals in the United States
Challenge: Rising wealth inequality and persistent social disparities experienced by racial and ethnic minorities in the US lead to significant vulnerability of racial and ethnic minorities and low socioeconomic status (SES) individuals to pandemic events
Solution: Invest funding heavily in community healthcare systems that serve racial and ethnic minorities and low SES individuals, where the need will be greatest

Study: Mental Health Services in Lombardy during COVID-19 outbreak.
Challenge: Lombardy is the Region in Italy the most heavily affected by coronavirus disease (COVID-19) contagion. The Regional Health Authority mandates that mental health services should be guaranteed, identifying mental health as a priority for their citizens.
Solution: Mental health services can provide care by using increased use of communication resouces, triaging over the telephone, and avoiding close contact in on-site appointments.

Study: Which Melbourne metropolitan areas are vulnerable to COVID-19 based on age, disability and access to health services? Using spatial analysis to identify service gaps and inform delivery.
Journal: Journal of Pain and Symptom Management
Challenge: Can Spatial Methods be used to determine which areas are vulnerable?
Solution: Spatial methods are increasingly becoming an essential method to inform health service planning and identify vulnerable populations.

Study: Telemedicine in the Time of Coronavirus
Journal: Journal of Pain and Symptom Management
Challenge: With the emergence of COVID-19, telemedicine has been catapulted into the role of a critically essential service for patients to help mitigate the spread of COVID19 and preserve valuable personal protective equipment.
Solution: Telemedicine is a proven modality for delivering palliative care.

Study: Feeding Low-Income Children during the Covid-19 Pandemic
Challenge: As Covid-19 spreads throughout the United States, schools and child care facilities are balancing their role of helping to prevent disease transmission with ensuring access to food for children who rely on the federal nutrition safety net
Solution: It is critical to ensure that the nutritional needs of vulnerable children are met in order to avoid exacerbating disparities in health and educational attainment for years to come.
